intro: Sherbournia curvipes, commonly known as the twisted-stemmed broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique, curved stems and small, yellowish flowers make it distinctive in its habitat. Sherbournia curvipes is often used in traditional medicine and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
